poem:
Crunchies and Batman Pens  

Bribed by sweet crunch,  
gold foil promise,  
school's tether loosens,  
childhood's tether tightens—  
Nish's laughter, a craft,  
born from bites of crisp  
and inked charm,  
unfurling on Tooting's stage—  
now, echoes through Durham's past,  
a comic's quip,  
etched in memory's  
daily stand-up.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Nish Kumar looks back: ‘My parents had to bribe me with Crunchies and Batman pens to stay in school’ Interactive Nish Kumar in 1991 and 2025. Main portrait: Pål Hansen. Styling: Andie Redman. Grooming: Neusa Neves at Arlington Artists using Stila cosmetics and Color Wow Hair. Archive image: courtesy of Nish Kumar Born in 1985 in Tooting, London, Nish Kumar is a comic and presenter. He started standup while at Durham University and has twice". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
